author: pipermerriam
content: There's no project tracking in place.  It'll be up to the Trin/Fluffy teams on whether they want to do something like that.  My expectations is that each team will (and currently is) maintain their own issue tracking, and that the specification for each network will serve as the development target.  That isn't to say that there isn't some additional resources that could help with onboarding new people to the project, but currently the weekly implementers call is our primary coordination point.  Teams are currently only working on the state network parts.

author: kolbyml
content:
Just a quick question uTP would be used on any request if the data being sent surpasses the max packet size of 1280 bytes correct? I see it mentioned on message 8 Request Proofs specifically,  but from the discv-5 doc I am under the impression it would be used for any message which exceeds the limit.
I just want some confirmation if my impression was correct or not.

author: pipermerriam
content: I'm referring to the loosely discussed plans for sharding where validators need to jump between shards quickly and perform block validation (via stateless execution) on different shards.  A stateless client that does that is useful for protocol infrastructure since it would allow validators to do that job without having to maintain the state for each shard.  This is what I mean by "infrastructure".

author: pipermerriam
content: Roughly speaking yes.  More precisely, or maybe just different words for the same thing... uTP would be used for any data transmission between nodes that either 1: exceeds the UDP packet size or 2: is better modeled as a stream of data (which also likely would exceed the UDP packet size).
